title: A1990 no display, small water damage on screen connector.
message:
water damage at the screen connector but at screen side, there is no water damage at the board , no backlight and no display. try also with good screen.
j8500:
PP5V_S0SW_LCD - 5.1V
PP3V3_S0SW_LCD - 3.4V
PP5V_S0_ALSCAM_F - 5.1V
PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKL - 0V
EDP_PANEL_PWR_BUF_EN - 3.4V
I2C_BKLT_SDA/SCL - 5.1V
I2C_TCON_SDA/SCL - 3.4V
I2C_ALS/I2C_CAM - 1.8V
MIPI_FTCAM_CLK - 0.4V

ALL THE REST 0V
any idea?

title: A1990 no display, small water damage on screen connector.
message:
"screen connector but at screen side"
It is connected to MLB directly.

Did you try another LCD assembly?
Check diode mode on data lines.

I cannot say more , as you didn't post MLB code yet...

title: A1990 no display, small water damage on screen connector.
message:
there was water damage at the screen side(screen board), but the water didn't touch the main board.
i was try another LCD but the same...

what lines?

hoo sorry..820-01041

title: A1990 no display, small water damage on screen connector.
A1990 no display, small water damage on screen connector.
message:
Mentioned connector replicates J8500 from the MLB.
The water spill affected MLB, of coruse.

Check diode mode to ground at EDP_INT lines.
Pay atention to EDP_INT_AUX_N.
If you have luck, maybe U9850 bad only.

title: A1990 no display, small water damage on screen connector.
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 68284, member: 682"]
Check diode mode to ground at EDP_INT lines.
Pay atention to EDP_INT_AUX_N.
[/QUOTE]
diode mode 450-500ohm

title: A1990 no display, small water damage on screen connector.

If yes, then is time to change U9850.
